III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
1

background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A AWOLed on 8/17/25. Upon return to the facility, Youth A
allegedly was verbally abused by staff. Staff reported she was too
much too handle and she should not have come back.
Investigation Interviews:
On 8/21/25, I spoke to Complainant via telephone. No other
additional information was provided other than the staff who was
verbally abusive was Social Woker.
The following interviews were conducted on 9/4/25 at the
facility.
Director reported Youth A is currently placed in the Zonta Group
Home. Director reported Social Worker is Youth A’s case
manager. Director reported they had a good relationship and there
were no issues that she was aware of between them.
Social Worker reported Youth A returned from an AWOL on
8/17/25. Civilian from the community had taken Youth A into her
home and contacted the facility to let them know Youth A was
safe. Social Worker reported they gave instructions to Civilian to
bring Youth A back to the facility. Civilian did so at 12:30pm the
following afternoon. Social Worker reported when Youth A came
back Civilian and Youth A were hugging each other and saying
they “love each other.” Social Worker reported Youth A went into
the waiting room with her and asked her questions to ensure she
was safe. Social Worker reported she talked to her about
strangers in the community and the risks of AWOLing. Social
Worker reported Youth A kept looking out the window and getting
agitated when people walked by. When Civilian left, she ran out of
the room to go after her. Youth A kept saying to Civilian, “don’t
leave me.” Social Worker reported they talked to Civilian
separately and reported she empathized with Civilian but told her
that if this were to occur in the future that she should call the
police and the facility right away so that they can come and get
Youth A. Social Worker reported Civilian was upset by this and
said, “I know what to do, you don’t have to tell me.” Social Worker
reported she did not state Youth A was “too much to handle,” “she
doesn’t belong here,” or encourage her to AWOL.
Clerk reported she was working when Youth A was brought back
by Civilian. Clerk reported Social Worker was present. Clerk
2

reported she had Civilian sign in and stated Youth A and Civilian
kept hugging each other and Civilian kept touching Youth’s face.
Clerk reported staff present (unsure of who), including herself
were grateful for Youth A returning. Clerk reported Youth A went
into the parlor (waiting room). Clerk reported when Civilian went to
leave Youth A started running after her and hugged her again.
Clerk reported she never heard anyone tell Youth A that she
should not be here, or encourage her to AWOL, or say anything
derogatory to Youth A. Everyone present was happy Youth A
returned safely.
Assistant reported she was present when Civilian brought Youth
A back from her AWOL. Assistant reported Youth A was talking to
Civilian and Civilian was telling her to be good and that she was
going to get licensed so that she could adopt her. Assistant
reported Youth A had ran after Civilian when Civilian was leaving
and hugged her and they both stated they “loved” each other.
Assistant reported she did not hear anyone tell Youth A she didn’t
belong at the facility, or encourage her to AWOL, or state she was
“too much to handle.” Assistant reported they were happy Youth A
returned and everyone was supportive.
Youth A reported she has been going AWOL lately. Youth A
reported she was brought back by Civilian on 8/18/25. Youth A
reported Civilian let her stay with her. Civilian allowed her to take
a shower, gave her food and clothes. Youth A reported when she
came back no one made derogatory comments to her or stated
she doesn’t belong at the facility or encouraged her to AWOL.
Youth A reported she stated to staff on 8/17/25 when upset, “I’m
going to AWOL if that is what you want.” Youth A did not
acknowledge any response from staff after she stated this. Youth
A reported everyone thinks she is going to AWOL so they are
constantly watching her and don’t trust her. Youth A reported this
“provokes” her to want to AWOL.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Social Worker personnel file
o Training was up to date. Social Worker had training
on “Effectively Responding to a Person in Crisis” on
7/3/25, “Verbal De-escalation Practice” on 5/9/25,
“Crisis Management Basics” on 5/3/25,
“Communication and Conflict Management” on
2/24/25.
o Central Registry Clearance is current, dated 5/16/25.
o There was no disciplinary action in her file pertaining
to these allegations or similar.
3

• Behavior management policy was reviewed, and the
agency does not allow derogatory comments towards
youth.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Based on interviews with
staff present and youth, there is no evidence that Youth A was
spoken to in a derogatory manner.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
